title: Suspect indicted on federal hate crime charges in shootings of 2 Jewish men in LA
description: A federal grand jury indicted the suspect who allegedly targeted and shot two Jewish men in the Los Angeles area on hate crime and weapons charges.

title: WATCH:  Neighbors rescue deer with leg caught in barbed wire fence
description: A couple rescued a young deer in distress with its foot caught in their neighbor's barbed wire fence and after recovering, the deer made "regular visits afterwards."

title: WATCH:  112-year-old gets heartwarming surprise birthday party
description: In Wellesley, Massachusetts, locals put together a special gathering to celebrate Herlda Senhouse, their oldest citizen.

title: Officials: Person dies after brain-eating amoeba infection
description: Health officials say a person in southwest Florida has died after being infected with an extremely rare brain-eating amoeba

title: Attorney Tom Girardi pleads not guilty to defrauding Lion Air crash victims
description: An attorney entered a not guilty plea on behalf of onetime powerhouse lawyer Tom Girardi who is charged with defrauding victims of the 2018 Lion Air crash.

title: Video shows Memphis jailers beating Black inmate who died
description: A video released by a Tennessee prosecutor shows the death of a Black man in a Memphis jail after he was beaten during a confrontation

title: Lesion removed during Biden's physical was cancerous, White House doctor says
description: “All cancerous tissue was successfully removed," Dr. Kevin O'Connor said.

title: Man dies at ski resort amid record snowfall
description: A man died at a California resort in the Lake Tahoe area after experiencing a serious incident on an expert trail.

title: World Bank: Quake caused damage worth $5.1 billion in Syria
description: The World Bank says that Syria has sustained an estimated $5.1 billion in damages in the massive Feb. 6 earthquake that hit northern parts of the country and also southeastern Turkey

title: How Chernobyl nuclear disaster altered the genetics of the dogs left behind
description: A population of wild dogs living near the Chernobyl exclusion zone is now giving scientists a glimpse into how long-term radiation exposure affects generations.

title: Iranian-American activist sounds alarm on suspected poisonings of Iranian schoolgirls
description: ABC News’ Linsey Davis spoke to Iranian-American activist Masih Alinejad about the suspected poisonings of Iranian schoolgirls.

title: 'The monster you become': Judge chastises Murdaugh before sentencing him to life
description: Judge Clifton Newman addressed Alex Murdaugh at length before sentencing him to life in prison on Friday for the murders of the former lawyer's wife and younger son.

title: East Palestine town hall gets heated
description: A town hall in East Palestine, Ohio, Thursday became heated as residents confronted town officials and Norfolk Southern, demanding answers about the train derailment.

title: Woman reported missing 31 years ago found in Puerto Rico
description: A Pennsylvania woman who went missing more than 30 years ago in a case that stumped authorities who later declared her legally dead has been found living in a nursing home in Puerto Rico

title: Trump seeks to bar Access Hollywood tape from defamation trial
description: Former President Trump is seeking to block the infamous 2005 Access Hollywood recording from being introduced as evidence in a defamation trial next month.

title: Fire at Indonesian oil depot kills 14; thousands evacuated
description: A large fire has broken out at a fuel storage depot in Indonesia’s capital, killing at least 17 people, injuring dozens of others and forcing the evacuation of thousands of nearby residents after spreading to their neighborhood

title: Ford to raise production as US auto sales start to recover
description: Ford says it will increase production of six models through the year as the company and the auto industry start to rebound from sluggish U.S. sales in 2022

title: Biden awards Medal of Honor to Black Vietnam War hero after paperwork 'lost' twice
description: President Biden hosted a Medal of Honor ceremony for an Army Special Forces vet who has waited close to 60 years to receive the nation's top award for military valor.

title: Santos was interviewed by Secret Service in 2017 as part of ATM fraud probe: Sources
description: Rep. George Santos was interviewed by Secret Service agents in 2017 as part of an ATM fraud investigation that targeted a friend of his, sources told ABC News.

title: College Park mayor charged with 56 counts of child pornography
description: College Park, Maryland Mayor Patrick Wojahn was arrested and charged with 56 counts of child pornography. He faces up to 360 years in prison.

title: U.S. offers reward of up to $5 million for Congo's IS leader
description: The U.S. Embassy in Congo says the U.S. is offering a reward of up to $5 million for information that could lead to the capture of Congo’s top jihadi, who leads an affiliate of the Islamic State group

title: Public drag performances restricted in Tennessee
description: Tennessee has restricted public drag performances, likening drag performances to other "adult cabaret."

title: Ericsson to pay $206M for breaking US deal in bribery case
description: Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson has agreed to plead guilty to U.S. foreign corruption violations and pay more than $206 million for breaking a deal with the Justice Department over charges of bribery and falsifying records.

title: King Charles III picks France, Germany for 1st state visits
description: King Charles III will travel to France and Germany for his first state visits since becoming monarch, underscoring Britain’s efforts to build bridges with its European neighbors

title: Little Rock Central students to walk out in protest of Sarah Sanders education bill
description: Students at the storied Little Rock Central High School are planning to walk out of classes on Friday in protest of Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders' LEARNS Act.

title: Did dioxins spread after the Ohio train derailment?
description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is ordering rail operator Norfolk Southern to begin testing for dioxins in the area where a train carrying toxic chemicals in Ohio

title: Russia seeks explanation for Serbian rockets in Ukraine
description: Russia is seeking an official explanation from its ally Serbia about media reports saying the Balkan country has delivered thousands of rockets to Ukraine

title: China accuses US of attacking companies after export curbs
description: China has accused Washington of improperly attacking Chinese companies after genetics analysis giant BGI Group and 17 others were hit with curbs on access to U.S. technology on security or human rights grounds

title: Nobel laureate Bialiatski sentenced to 10 years in Belarus
description: A Belarusian court has sentenced Ales Bialiatski, Belarus’ top human rights advocate and one of the winners of the 2022 Nobel Peace Prize, to 10 years in prison

title: Alex Murdaugh sentencing live updates: Disgraced attorney faces 30 years to life
description: A jury on Thursday found disgraced South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh guilty of brutally murdering his wife and younger son at the family's property in 2021.

title: Pentagon Papers leaker Ellsberg announces terminal cancer
description: Daniel Ellsberg, who copied and leaked documents that revealed secret details of U.S. strategy in the Vietnam War and became known as the Pentagon Papers, says he has terminal cancer and months to live

title: 13 arrested after ‘riot’ breaks out at high school
description: Thirteen people have been arrested after “a disturbance turned into several fights” that left at least one person in the hospital at a high school in Arkansas.

title: UN rights group says Nicaragua executed 40 people
description: A U.N. human rights groups said the government of Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega executed at least 40 people and ordered hospitals not to treat demonstrators wounded in antigovernment protests

title: 'We don't know' what apparently poisoned Iranian schoolgirls, White House says
description: Hundreds of girls appear to have been overcome by noxious fumes.

title: Gabby Petito's family contends Utah cops treated Laundrie like victim
description: Brian Laundrie “seemed like a mental and emotional bully” to a cop who responded to a domestic call weeks before Gabby Petito was killed, according to an amended lawsuit.

title: Court overturns California man's murder conviction, citing new 'rap lyrics' law
description: A California court overturned the murder conviction of a man who was sentenced to 129 years to life, ruling that the use of a rap video as evidence violates a new law.

title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein hospitalized with shingles but expects 'full recovery'
description: California Sen. Dianne Feinstein has been hospitalized in her home state with shingles.

title: Alex Murdaugh found guilty in murder of wife, son
description: The jury in the double murder trial of Alex Murdaugh reached a verdict after nearly three hours of deliberations.
